name: Magnesium bromide
desc: Magnesium bromide (MgBr2) is a chemical compound of magnesium and bromine that is white and deliquescent. It is often used as a mild sedative and as an anticonvulsant for treatment of nervous disorders. It is water-soluble and somewhat soluble in alcohol. It can be found naturally in small amounts in some minerals such as: bischofite and carnallite, and in sea water, such as that of the Dead Sea.
Appearance: white hygroscopic hexagonal crystals (anhydrous) colorless monoclinic crystals (hexahydrate)
Solubility:
ethanol: 6.9 g/100 mL
methanol: 21.8 g/100 mL
Other anions:
magnesium fluoride
magnesium chloride
magnesium iodide
Other cations:
Beryllium bromide
Calcium bromide
Strontium bromide
Barium bromide
Radium bromide
